image.altText: A sporting coach at a media conference.

props.synopsis: After more than a dozen years as Port Adelaide coach, Ken Hinkley will pass the reins to senior assistant Josh Carr at the end of the season, the club has revealed.

title.children: Hinkley to step down at AFL season's end as Power reveals Carr as successor

image.altText: A police blue tent set up a distance away from a white car behind a police line

props.synopsis: A detective has told an inquest of her frustration and regret in the way the death of an Aboriginal woman was investigated in a regional New South Wales town.

title.children: Inquest scrutinises police investigation into Aboriginal mother's death

image.altText: Ambulances outside a regional hospital.

props.synopsis: A report by the doctors' union says ambulance ramping is now a common occurrence at Mount Gambier Hospital, and patients and staff are being put at risk. But the state government says an expansion is underway.

title.children: Ramping 'common' at regional SA hospital as issue comes to the country

image.altText: A drying dam with only a small amount of water in a brown, rocky landscape

props.synopsis: Rainwater tanks, dams, and springs are running dry in Adelaide Hills and Fleurieu Peninsula while water carriers say they are struggling to meet the demand from both farmers and households.

title.children: Running out of water after record low rainfall in parts of SA

image.altText: A woman standing next to a barber chair.

props.synopsis: Skills shortages, network connectivity issues and added freight costs are just some of the challenges for business owners in regional Australia — but one business group says it's forcing them to be more innovative.

title.children: Insight into what it's like starting a business in a remote town

image.altText: sharks seen from below circling under water

props.synopsis: As the number of shark attacks decline globally, a new report reveals how many incidents occurred in 2024.

title.children: US had triple the unprovoked shark bites compared to Australia in 2024

image.altText: A close-up of an Indian man with glasses.

props.synopsis: After a week of increased scrutiny on GFG Alliance, Sanjeev Gupta says his company is "steadily ramping up production" and asks stakeholders to "work together".

title.children: Gupta is 'finalising new financing' to 'catch up' with GFG's creditors

image.altText: Two men holding up orange cooked crabs standing in front of a boat on its trailor.

props.synopsis: A public chest freezer in the tiny Eyre Peninsula hamlet of Arno Bay is limiting the amount of fish waste going into bins and providing free bait.

title.children: Coastal SA town's community freezer ends big stink at boat ramp

image.altText: A sign in an outback town which says "Welcome to Oodnadatta, Australia's hottest driest town."

props.synopsis: Temperatures are expected to soar across South Australia on Wednesday, with several towns predicted to reach peaks above 45 degrees Celsius, including a top of 49C at Oodnadatta, in the state's far north.

title.children: Hot weather warning for SA as high temperature records expected to be broken

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: A 68-year-old woman has been charged with leaving the scene of an accident after a car allegedly mounted a median strip and hit a 13-year-old girl, who suffered injuries including a fractured pelvis.

title.children: Girl crossing road hit by car that drove onto Adelaide median strip

image.altText: An alleged dangerous driver outside the Christies Beach Magistrates Court.

props.synopsis: Rachel Secker, who was forced into a pole after being tailgated in Adelaide's south, tells a court that the actions of driver Matthew James Hollitt had a profound impact on her wellbeing.

title.children: Young motorcyclist confronts tailgater who 'derailed' her life

image.altText: An older couple sit side by side in a waiting room, in front of a large sign that says "Medicare Urgent Care Clinic".

props.synopsis: The operator of SA's Mount Gambier Medicare Urgent Care Clinic has entered liquidation, raising concerns about the viability of the clinics.

title.children: Urgent Care Clinic operator in liquidation amid doctor shortage

image.altText: A man in a beekeeping suit tends to his bees amongst the trees.

props.synopsis: Bushfires that have burnt through wilderness areas in Tasmania are now threatening trees that grow nowhere else in the world and are critical to the state's honey industry — as authorities confirm an Overland Track hut has been lost to fire.

title.children: Bushfire threat to worsen with beekeepers fearing hives won't survive

image.altText: File photo: Federal Parliament House (ABC Canberra)

props.synopsis: Australia has been ranked 10th in Transparency International's annual Corruption Index. It's the first time since 2016 that Australia has been placed in the top 10.

title.children: Australia improves ranking on the global corruption index

image.altText: A man with blue scrubs holding a blood pressure band

props.synopsis: Former Flinders Medical Centre nurse Geoffrey Leonard Atkins "lost his temper" and retaliated against a "highly vulnerable" patient who had thrown his head back into his face. A tribunal judgement banning the nurse from providing any health service, reveals the physically infirm patient was also ''hip-tossed'' into hospital bed railings.

title.children: 'No clinical or justifiable purpose': Nurse banned over patient headlock

image.altText: John F Kennedy, Jaqueline Kennedy and John Connolly riding in an open-top limousine in front of another black car

props.synopsis: In 2025, questions remain about what else there is to know about the killing, why Donald Trump wants to expose the unknown, and whether the remaining files will alter the only version of events the world has ever known.

title.children: After 62 years, this is why Trump wants to expose JFK assassination files

image.altText: A young boy wearing a basketball singlet smiles for the camera.

props.synopsis: The WA Supreme Court hears testimony from the teenager at the centre of a "love triangle" that sparked a series of events ending in the alleged murder of Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey.

title.children: 'Love triangle' set off events ending in Cassius Turvey's death, trial told

image.altText: headshot of Liam Neeson

props.synopsis: Northern Ireland-born superstar Liam Neeson hits regional Victoria for The Mongoose, his third film in the state in four years.

title.children: Hollywood action star wows fans ahead of Victorian shoot for new movie

image.altText: pedestrians walk past the reserve bank of australia building

props.synopsis: The figure that influences how high people's mortgage repayments are set has been 4.35 per cent since November 2023.

title.children: Why interest rates haven't changed for a year

image.altText: Belle Gibson, with her hair in a ponytail, wearing black sunglasses and a black coat.

props.synopsis: Netflix is purporting to tell the story of wellness scammer Belle Gibson in their new series, but the show stops short of showing the messy legal fallout following Gibson's professional implosion.

title.children: After her cancer scam rocked Australia, where is Belle Gibson now?

image.altText: An older man in a suit and red, spotted tie, speaks into a microphone on a podium during an address.

props.synopsis: The major parties have agreed to more than double the donation threshold, ending a months-long stalemate to strike a deal that will infuriate the crossbench.

title.children: Labor and Coalition strike electoral reform deal

image.altText: Two intruders break into a home looking for car keys.

props.synopsis: Amid increasing public frustration and anger about youth crime, Victoria's latest statistics show youth crime is at record levels and police are blaming repeat offenders.

title.children: Watch as youths break into house to steal car keys as part of crime wave

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A close up shot of a woman wearing a white blazer and black and white shirt.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price has called on the federal government to intervene in the NT's Central Land Council after revelations about the criminal history of its chair Warren Williams.

title.children: Senator calls for land council probe after chair's criminal past revealed

image.altText: 'Slum' graffiti on a development sign.

props.synopsis: A debate over social housing in one of WA's popular coastal cities has led to words including "slum" being scrawled over development signs.

title.children: NIMBY graffiti targets social housing development in WA's South West

image.altText: A house with its roof completely blown off.

props.synopsis: There have been nearly 20,000 storm-related calls in NSW since the start of October and the season isn't over yet, with forecasters warning thunderstorms are possible every day for the rest of the week.

title.children: SES averaging 140 jobs a day as NSW storms cause 'mass devastation'

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

props.synopsis: Dawson has lodged a special leave application in the High Court, as he seeks to secure a new trial, 40 years after he killed his wife.

title.children: Convicted killer Chris Dawson launches High Court appeal bid

image.altText: A Matildas players dribbles the ball with her right foot while under defensive pressure from a USA opponent.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr has been cleared by the courts but her public image has been damaged, and questions remain around her suitability to represent her country.

title.children: Sam Kerr's trial started uncomfortable conversations about anti-white racism

image.altText: An aerial shot of an aluminium smelting plant, with the coastline on the horizon

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's hopes of securing an exemption from Donald Trump's incoming metals tariffs have been dealt a blow, with a senior presidential adviser accusing Australia of "killing the aluminium market".

title.children: Trump aide says Australia 'killing aluminium market' as US tariffs loom

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese sat at a desk in front of a phone.

props.synopsis: Australia is one of the few countries the US has a trade surplus with. Here's why that could help make the country's case for a tariff exemption.

title.children: How a trade surplus with the US could grant Australia a tariff exemption

image.altText: A black schnauzer sitting next to its owner with a trophy and ribbon after having won a dog competition

props.synopsis: It's the first Westminster best-in-show title for a giant schnauzer in the 95 years the breed has been entered.

title.children: A giant schnauzer has won the Westminster Dog Show. Here's how judges pick a winner

image.altText: A man smiles standing in front of some tennis courts.

props.synopsis: A 38-year-old was arrested by detectives on the Gold Coast after investigations into a string of alleged historical child sexual offences.

title.children: Junior coach arrested at tournament and charged with sex offences

image.altText: Gout Gout holding his shoe to his ear like a telephone, celebrating a race win

props.synopsis: The brightest new star of Australian athletics, sprint sensation Gout Gout, is set to contest the nation's oldest footrace.

title.children: Teen sprinting sensation Gout Gout to run in Stawell Gift

image.altText: A woman in a black suit looks solemn, walking besides a lawyer dressed in official attire

props.synopsis: On the final day of Antoinette Lattouf's unlawful termination case against the ABC, her former manager agreed that she was told posting information from a reputable organisation on social media was allowed.

title.children: Lattouf was told posting information from 'reputable organisation' was OK

image.altText: Compilation of images including a Iraqi sniper firing a weapon, a brain scan and a silhouette of a man

props.synopsis: Aussie veterans who helped train Iraqi snipers say they were exposed to hundreds of blasts a day, leaving them with long-term brain injuries.

title.children: Snipers suffer irreversible brain damage from 'invisible shock waves'
